course: Introduction to Data Science with Beginning R and Python

scenario.title: Operations Manager (Logistics)
scenario.description: Paul is an operations manager in logistics with two decades of experience. As automation and AI reshape his field, he wants to reskill into business intelligence or analytics. He is a true beginner at coding and worries about keeping up with younger peers.

expectations: A welcoming, start-from-zero experience with hands-on practice, clear milestones, reassurance for mid-career learners, and a recognizable credential to support a career transition.

actions: Reads trade articles about AI’s impact on logistics.
Searches for beginner data science programs in North Carolina.
pains: Fear he’s too old to retrain.

feelings.quote: If I don’t adapt now, I’ll fall behind.

opportunities: Feature mid-career alumni success stories and case studies.
Publish a beginner readiness guide that normalizes ramp-up time.

actions: Compares NC State page with community college and MOOC options.
Checks difficulty level, prerequisites, and weekly time.
pains: Worried about keeping pace with the cohort.

feelings.quote: I’m ready to try, but I don’t want to be left behind.

opportunities: Emphasize beginner-first design and scaffolded assignments.
Clarify support: office hours, mentor access, and pacing checkpoints.

actions: Registers online and pays out of pocket.
Downloads course calendar and blocks time.
pains: Uncertainty about ROI without employer funding.

feelings.quote: This is a leap of faith.

opportunities: Offer installment plans and refund windows.
Provide a step-by-step enrollment guide with screenshots.

actions: Replays recorded lectures to reinforce learning.
Completes applied exercises tied to logistics scenarios.
Attends extra office hours for troubleshooting.

feelings.quote: It’s hard, but I’m proving I can do it.

opportunities: Structured milestones with celebratory feedback on completion.
Mentorship pairing and optional fundamentals refreshers.
